articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Why Maui's deadly wildfires spread so quickly | CBC News
articles.description: Strong winds from an offshore hurricane, combined with dry, hot weather and the proliferation of non-native grasses on the Hawaiian island of Maui created the conditions for the deadly and devastating wildfires, experts say.
articles.content:
The wildfires that rapidly swept across Maui this week led to thousands of evacuations, burnt-out homes and the deaths of at least 55 people.
